ðŸ”¥ Text-Grab | C#
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Quickly and easily copying text from any visible source on a Windows screen, including images, videos, or application elements where text is not selectable.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Optical Character Recognition (OCR) for screen text â€¢ Local OCR processing via Windows API â€¢ Copy text to clipboard â€¢ Full-Screen Grab Mode (select region or click word)
ðŸ“– Summary: Text Grab is a C# Windows utility that uses Optical Character Recognition (OCR) to extract and copy text from any visible content on the screen. It leverages the Windows API for local OCR processing, offering multiple modes for flexible text capture without requiring a constant background process.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ HuggingFaceModelDownloader | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Downloading models and datasets from the Hugging Face Hub with enhanced speed, reliability, and user interface options.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Resumable downloads with SHA-256 and size-based verification â€¢ Multipart parallel downloads with up to 16 connections per file â€¢ Simultaneous download of multiple files â€¢ Colorful terminal UI (TUI) with progress bars â€¢ Web-based dashboard for managing downloads
ðŸ“– Summary: HuggingFaceModelDownloader is a Go utility designed for efficiently downloading models and datasets from the Hugging Face Hub. It offers features like resumable and multipart downloads, a user-friendly TUI and Web UI, and a Go library for programmatic integration.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ abogen | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Generating audiobooks and voiceovers from text-based documents with synchronized captions.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Converts EPUB, PDF, text, markdown, and subtitle files to audio. â€¢ Generates synchronized captions for the audio. â€¢ Uses the Kokoro-82M model for high-quality text-to-speech. â€¢ Supports installation via script (Windows) or uv (with CUDA support for NVIDIA GPUs).
ðŸ“– Summary: Abogen is a Python-based tool that converts various document formats (EPUB, PDF, text, markdown, subtitles) into audiobooks with synchronized captions. It utilizes the Kokoro-82M model for natural-sounding text-to-speech and can be used for creating audio content for platforms like Instagram, YouTube, and TikTok.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ holehe | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Information gathering and OSINT by checking email account existence across multiple online platforms.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Checks email registration status on over 120 websites â€¢ Utilizes forgotten password function to avoid detection â€¢ Provides information on account existence, and sometimes partial recovery details â€¢ Can be used via CLI or embedded in Python applications â€¢ Supports asynchronous operations with Trio and httpx
ðŸ“– Summary: Holehe is a Python tool designed to check if an email address is registered on a wide variety of websites. It leverages the 'forgotten password' functionality of these sites to discreetly gather this information without alerting the user.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ TLG_JoinCaptchaBot | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Preventing unverified or bot accounts from joining and spamming Telegram groups.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Automatic CAPTCHA challenges for new users â€¢ User removal for failed CAPTCHA attempts â€¢ Time limit for CAPTCHA solving â€¢ Anti-spam by deleting URL messages from unverified users â€¢ Support for multiple languages (localization)
ðŸ“– Summary: TLG_JoinCaptchaBot is a Python-based Telegram bot that automatically verifies new users joining a group by presenting them with an image CAPTCHA. It removes users who fail to solve the challenge within a time limit and also combats spam by deleting messages with URLs from unverified users.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
